description: Cymru Premier sides Caernarfon Town and Penybont are knocked out of the Nathaniel MG Cup on penalties by second tier clubs.
title: Nathaniel MG Cup: Caernarfon, Penybont and Newtown knocked out on penalties
title_page: Nathaniel MG Cup: Caernarfon, Penybont and Newtown knocked out on penalties - BBC Sport
maintext:
Cymru Premier sides Caernarfon Town, Penybont and Newtown have been knocked out of the Nathaniel MG Cup on penalties by second tier clubs.
Caernarfon were beaten 4-2 on penalties by Porthmadog, who secured a 2-2 draw in normal time thanks to Morgan Owen's late goal .
Also on Friday evening, Afan Lido beat Penybont 5-4 on penalties after it finished 1-1 in normal time.
Guilsfield of the Cymru North beat Newtown 4-3 on penalties after it had ended 1-1 after 90 minutes.
Swansea City's Under-21 side advanced to the third round with a 3-1 win over Caerau Ely while The New Saints beat Connah's Quay 2-1 and Aberystwyth won 2-1 at Barry Town.
Holders Bala Town overcame second tier opponents, winning 4-0 at Ruthin Town.
Pontypridd United secured their place in the second round with a 4-1 win at Llanelli.
Also on Friday evening, Prestatyn Town beat fellow Cymru North side Flint Town United 4-1 on penalties while Briton Ferry Llansawel were 3-1 winners over Llantwit Major.
